bibl.title: Letter from F.N. Raymond to John J. Moran, January 19, 1937

div1.p: Raymond writes that he heard Moran on Lowell Thomas' radio program.

div1.head: Letter from F.N. Raymond to John J. Moran, January 19, 1937
div1.opener:
GOODYEAR
The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Export Co., Ltd.
AVE. PONCE DE LEON 32
SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO
January 19, 1937.
CABLE & TELEGRAPH
GOODYEAR
PHONE 605. S. J
P. O. BOX 5155
PUERTA DE TIERRA, P. R.
Mr. John J. Morán, President
Compañía Sunoco de Cuba
Avenida Menocal
La Habana, Cuba
Dear Johnny:
div1.p:
We do not customarily listen to Lowell Thomas but by a
strange coincidence we tuned in last night just in time to
hear your interesting little talk on that great experience
back in 1900.

It was a pleasure to hear something from you again and
I am sure that we would have recognized your voice even if
we had not heard Lowell Thomas' announcement at the beginning.

We are all looking forward to see you and Mrs. Morán
again one of these days and we all join in wishing you all
the best for the New Year and the years to come.
Paul Riveire is here with me and sends regards.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, F. N. Raymond F N Raymond
